info.title: Platform Administration Legacy API v1
info.description: Legacy v1 Platform API endpoints for platform administration domain including businesses, staff, tokens, webhooks, categories, fields, forms, and directory management

get.description:
## Overview
Search for a business by external_reference_id or email.

Available for **Directory Tokens only**.

> **Note**: At least one filter parameter (email, external_id, or external_reference_id) is required for the API to return a result.

parameters.description: Filter by email specified (make sure its URL-encoded)
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Filter by "external_id" specified. **Deprecate**. This will still work, but for new implementation please use external_reference_id.
parameters.name: external_id

post.description:
## Overview
Creates a Business. By default, business creation is synchronous. To create a business asynchronously, set the 'synchronized' parameter to false in the 'meta' object. When set to false, the request returns immediately after input parameters validation and an async job is created to handle the business account creation.

## Uniqueness Constraint
The `admin_account.email` field must be unique across the entire platform. Attempting to create a business with an email that already exists will return a 400 error: 'admin_account.email already in use'.

**Testing Tip**: Use a dynamically generated email (e.g., with timestamp or UUID suffix) to avoid conflicts with existing accounts.

Available for **Directory and Internal tokens**.

parameters.name: body

country_name.description: Business’s Country. Must be a valid country name

display_name.description: Owner’s display name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines (if not provided, FIRST NAME + LAST NAME will be used)

email.description: Owner's email, also used as the business's main email. Must be unique across the platform - attempting to create a business with an email that already exists will return a 400 error.

first_name.description: Owner’s first name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

language.description: One of en,es,fr,it,pt,de,pl,nl,en-GB. Default determined by Directory

last_name.description: Owner’s last name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

phone.description: Business phone number. Up to 20 characters

address.description: Business address. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

business_category.description: The business main occupation. Must be a valid business category

hide_address.description: Whether to show the business address to clients

landing_page.description: Deprecated - Previously used for marketing purposes, up to 255 characters

logo_url.description: Business logo URL - A valid image URL. Supporting formats: jpg, jpeg, gif, png, SVG. Make sure the URL includes one of these extensions. The URL will be validated by attempting to download the file to verify it exists.

name.description: Business name. Up to 100 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

short_description.description: Short description of the business. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

time_zone.description: Time zone name from MAPPING object found in: https://api.rubyonrails.org/v4.2.3/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html, Default value is determined by the Directory

website_url.description: Business's website URL. Must be a valid URL address including http/https.

google_client_id.description: Google Analytics ID to be embedded in the client portal, helping businesses to track their clients using Google Analytics. Must be a valid ID from Google

mixpanel_id.description: Mixpanel ID for mixpanel integration (up to 80 characters). Matching pattern tracking of business actions

audit.description: For internal tracking of business actions. Example: [{"context": {"source_key": "string"}, "action": "marketing_attribution"}]

external_id.description: Legacy, replaced by external_reference_id. It may also be referred to as a 'nickname'. Must contain at least one lowercase letter, can include numbers, and dots, at least 5 characters long, platform unique

external_reference_id.description: Unique id that represents the business in the partner’s systems

identities.description: Array of valid identity uids. Identities represent different occupational verticals. To obtain a full list of identities, please contact support

in_setup.description: Whether the business is in setup mode

intents.description: List of modules the business wishes to use in the product from this list: ["accept_payments_tile", "documents_and_forms", "add_online_scheduling", "secure_portal_for_clients", "promotions", "manage_client_records"]

invite.description: Reference id to the marketing channel

is_template.description: Whether this account can be used as a template for creating more businesses

synchronized.description: When set to true, the business account is created synchronously. When set to false, the business account is created asynchronously - the request returns immediately after input parameters validation and an async job is created to handle the business account creation

note.description: An administrative note about the business. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

suggested_identities.description: List of suggested identities to tailor the business experience

tags.description: A list of comma-separated tags. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

template_business_id.description: Configure the newly created business similar to the provided business id

parameters.x-example-note: Replace {{$timestamp}} with a unique value (e.g., Unix timestamp or UUID) to avoid email uniqueness conflicts.

200.description: Business Created. When 'synchronized' is true (default), the response includes the complete business data. When 'synchronized' is false, the response is returned immediately after validation and the business creation is processed asynchronously. In the asynchronous case, the final result will be delivered via webhook: success notifications are sent to subscribers of the 'business' entity with event_type 'create', and failure notifications are sent to subscribers of the 'account' entity with event_type 'rejected'.

business.description: Business data wrapper containing all business-related information

admin_account.description: Admin account details for the created business

staff_uid.description: Unique identifier for the staff member

created_at.description: Timestamp when the business was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the business was last updated

directory_id.description: Unique identifier of the directory the business belongs to

country_name.description: Country where the business is located

disable_analytics.description: Whether analytics are disabled for this business

dedicated_number.description: Dedicated phone number for the business

hide_address.description: Whether to hide the business address from clients

landing_page.description: Default landing page for the business

account_blocked_at.description: Timestamp when the account was blocked, if applicable

scheduling_disabled.description: Whether scheduling is disabled for this business

identities.description: List of identity identifiers associated with the business

in_setup.description: Whether the business is in setup mode

is_template.description: Whether this business is a template

invite.description: Reference ID to the marketing channel used for business acquisition

booking_settings.description: Settings related to booking and scheduling for the business

buffer_before.description: Buffer time in minutes before appointments

buffer_after.description: Buffer time in minutes after appointments

min_advance_booking.description: Minimum advance booking time in minutes

max_advance_booking.description: Maximum advance booking time in days

min_hours_before_meeting.description: Minimum hours required before a meeting can be scheduled

future_bookings_limit.description: Maximum number of days in the future that bookings can be made

branding.description: Branding configuration for the business including colors and visual settings

primary_color.description: Primary brand color in hex format

secondary_color.description: Secondary brand color in hex format

color.description: Main brand color in hex format

large_logo_url.description: URL to the large version of the business logo

xlarge_logo_url.description: URL to the extra-large version of the business logo

profile_picture_url.description: URL to the business profile picture

cover_picture_url.description: URL to the business cover picture

400.description:
Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided. Common causes include:
- **Email uniqueness constraint**: The email address in `admin_account.email` is already in use by another business account. Returns: 'admin_account.email already in use'
- **Missing required fields**: The `admin_account.email` field is required. Returns: 'admin_account.email is required'
- **Invalid email format**: The email address doesn't match standard email format. Returns: 'admin_account.email must be valid'
- **Validation errors**: Business name contains restricted terms, fields exceed length limits, or invalid values provided.

message.description: Human-readable error message describing the issue

data.description: Array of specific validation error messages

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

409.description: Conflict - A business with the provided email or external_reference_id already exists.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

get.description:
## Overview
Validates username/password credentials for login. The API will be blocked for the username after 5 failed attempts.

Available for **Directory tokens**.

parameters.description: Email address of the business owner (used as username for login)
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: Password for the business owner account
parameters.name: password

200.description: Login credentials validated successfully. Returns authentication status indicating whether the provided username and password are valid.

post.description:
## Overview
This API performs entitlement verification for businesses seeking to register with a specific partner. It checks if a business exists in the partner's pre-loaded audience list and is eligible to be claimed.

## How It Works
Partners pre-load their eligible businesses into the `audiences` table (via CSV upload or Audiences API). Each audience record contains a `unique_validation_identifier` field that uniquely identifies the business (e.g., email address, tax ID, membership number).

This endpoint looks up the audience record by matching:
- `directory_uid` (from the Directory token)
- `unique_validation_identifier` (from the request body)
- `status` is not 'deleted'

## Use Case
Before creating a new business account under a partner directory, call this endpoint to verify the business is in the partner's approved audience list.

Available for **Directory tokens only**.

unique_validation_identifier.description: The unique identifier used to look up the business in the partner's audience table. This value must exactly match the `unique_validation_identifier` field of an existing audience record for the partner's directory. Common values include: email address (e.g., 'john@doe.com'), tax ID, membership number, or any partner-specific identifier. The value is provided by the partner when they upload their audience list.

200.description: Audience record found. Returns the audience record from the partner's audience table, confirming the business is eligible for partnership enrollment.

data.description: The audience record from the audiences table

unique_external_identifier.description: Partner's reference ID for this business

unique_validation_identifier.description: The validation identifier used for claim verification

status.description: Current status of the audience record

business_uid.description: vcita business UID (populated after the audience is claimed)

400.description: Bad Request - No audience record found matching the provided unique_validation_identifier in the partner's directory. The business is not in the partner's approved audience list.

401.description: Unauthorized - Only Directory tokens are accepted for this endpoint. Staff, App, and Admin tokens will be rejected.

get.description:
## Overview
Retrieves detailed information about a specific business by its ID, including admin account details and business information.

Available for **Staff and Directory tokens**.

200.description: Business details retrieved successfully. Returns complete business information including admin account details and business data.

admin_account.description: Admin account details for the business

staff_uid.description: Unique identifier for the staff member

created_at.description: Timestamp when the business was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the business was last updated

directory_id.description: Unique identifier of the directory the business belongs to

country_name.description: Country where the business is located

disable_analytics.description: Whether analytics tracking is disabled for this business

dedicated_number.description: Dedicated phone number for the business

hide_address.description: Whether to hide the business address from public view

landing_page.description: Landing page URL for the business

business_maturity_in_years.description: How long the business has been operating (e.g., '0.5', '1', '5')

account_blocked_at.description: Timestamp when the account was blocked, null if not blocked

blocked_at.description: Timestamp when promotional emails were blocked

block_count.description: Number of times promotional emails have been blocked

scheduling_disabled.description: Whether scheduling is disabled for this business

structured_address.description: Structured address information with individual components

external_id.description: External identifier for integration purposes (stored as nickname)

external_reference_id.description: External reference identifier for integration purposes

plan_name.description: Display name of the subscription plan

staff_slots.description: Number of staff slots included in the plan

external_subscription_params.description: Additional parameters for external subscription management

min_hours_before_meeting.description: Minimum hours required before a meeting can be booked

future_bookings_limit.description: Maximum number of days in advance that bookings can be made

branding.description: Business branding and visual customization settings

large_logo_url.description: URL to the large version of the business logo

xlarge_logo_url.description: URL to the extra-large version of the business logo

profile_picture_url.description: URL to the business profile picture

cover_picture_url.description: URL to the business cover picture

note.description: Internal note or comment about the business

tags.description: Tags associated with the business for categorization

in_setup.description: Whether the business is currently in setup mode

is_template.description: Whether this business is a template business

identities.description: List of business identities for content management

auth_token.description: Authentication token for the business owner

marketing_channel.description: Marketing channel through which the business was acquired

integrations.description: Third-party integrations configured for the business

external_id.description: External identifier for the plugin instance

plan_terminated_at.description: When the plugin plan was terminated

site_url.description: Site URL associated with the plugin

post.description:
## Overview
Updates an existing business. This endpoint allows updating business information, admin account details, integrations, and subscription plan. Only provided fields will be updated.

Available for **Directory & Internal Tokens**.

> **Note:** Directory Tokens require the directory to be configured with manual billing. Staff Tokens may work for businesses not associated with a directory and with non-Recurly subscriptions.

country_name.description: Business’s Country. Must be a valid country name

display_name.description: Owner’s display name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines (if not provided, FIRST NAME + LAST NAME will be used)

email.description: Owner’s email, also used as the business’s main email

first_name.description: Owner’s first name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

language.description: One of en,es,fr,it,pt,de,pl,nl,en-GB,he,keys,pseudo - Default value is determined by the Directory

last_name.description: Owner’s last name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

phone.description: Business phone number. Up to 20 characters

address.description: Business address. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

business_category.description: The business main occupation. Must be a valid business category

business_maturity_in_years.description: Business maturity in years. Valid value is one of [null, 0, 0.5, 0.5-2, 2+]

hide_address.description: Whether to show the business address to clients

landing_page.description: Deprecated - Previously used for marketing purposes, up to 255 characters

logo_url.description: Business logo URL - A valid image URL. Supporting formats: jpg, jpeg, gif, png, SVG. Make sure the URL includes one of these extensions

name.description: Business name. Up to 100 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

phone.description: Business phone number. Up to 20 characters

scheduling_disabled.description: Business is not offering online scheduling through client portal

short_description.description: Short description of the business. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

time_zone.description: Time zone name from MAPPING object found in: https://api.rubyonrails.org/v4.2.3/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html . Default value is determined by the Directory

website_url.description: Business’s website URL. Must be a valid URL address including http/https.

external_id.description: Legacy, replaced by external_reference_id. It may also be referred to as a 'nickname'. Must contain at least one lowercase letter, can include numbers, and dots, at least 5 characters long, platform unique

plan_name.description: Package name to subscribe the external party instance to

site_url.description: Site url of the external party instance

external_reference_id.description: Unique id that represents the business in the partner's systems

external_subscription_params.description: External Subscription Parameters (should not be used with recurly type)

plan_name.description: Package name to subscribe (for manual type) / recurly plan code (for recurly type)

staff_slots.description: Staff sub accounts limit (should not be used with recurly type)

200.description: Business updated successfully. Returns the updated business information including admin account, business details, integrations, and subscription plan.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided for business update. The request contains invalid or missing required fields, or validation errors occurred.

404.description: Not Found - The specified business ID does not exist or you do not have permission to access it.

401.description: Unauthorized - The provided token type is not authorized for this endpoint. This endpoint requires Directory or Internal tokens. Staff tokens are not permitted.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

get.description:
## Overview
Get Directory's branding including logo url and colors, available for **Staff & Directory Tokens**.

200.description: Successfully retrieved directory branding information. Returns logo URL, color scheme (primary, secondary, text colors), directory name, and unique identifier.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

get.description:
## Overview
Get tokens list. Tokens can be filtered by app_id, user_id, or directory_id. Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

201.description: Tokens list retrieved successfully. Returns an array of tokens matching the specified filters (app_id, user_id, or directory_id).

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

post.description:
## Overview
Creates a token for authentication. Tokens can be created for applications (app_id), businesses (business_id), or directories (directory_id). At least one identifier must be provided. Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

app_id.description: A unique identifier for a 3rd party application.

business_id.description: A unique identifier for a business.

directory_id.description: The numeric ID of a directory (partner). This is the internal database ID, not the UID (e.g., 1121 instead of "qcpvme5au9c3vf0h").

201.description: Token created successfully. Returns the generated authentication token that can be used for API access.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided. At least one identifier (app_id, business_id, or directory_id) must be provided.

application/json.message: At least one identifier must be provided

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

404.description: Not Found - The specified app_id, business_id, or directory_id does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

post.description:
## Overview
Revoke a specific access token by providing the token value. The token must be accessible by the authenticated caller (e.g., a Directory token can only revoke tokens it issued).

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

## Authorization Rules
- **Staff tokens**: Can revoke tokens associated with the authenticated user.
- **Directory tokens**: Can revoke tokens they issued to users or apps within their directory.
- **Application tokens**: Can revoke tokens they issued to users within their directory.

## Error Handling
- Returns 422 with `"error": "Unauthorized"` if the caller does not have permission to revoke the specified token.
- Returns 422 with `"error": "invalid token"` if the provided token value does not exist.

token.description: The access token value to revoke. This is the actual token string (e.g., "abc123xyz"), not a token identifier or UID.

201.description: Token revoked successfully. Returns the list of tokens that were revoked.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token in the request header.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - The request was valid but could not be processed. This occurs when the caller does not have permission to revoke the specified token, or when the provided token value does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

post.description:
## Overview
Subscribe to webhook notifications. Webhooks allow you to receive real-time notifications when specific events occur in the system. You must specify the event (a combined string of entity and event_type in the format 'entity/event_type') and the target_url where notifications will be sent.

Available for **Staff and Directory Tokens**.

## Event Format
The `event` parameter uses the format `entity/event_type` where:
- **entity**: The object type to monitor (e.g., 'client', 'business', 'meeting', 'payment')
- **event_type**: The action that triggers the notification (e.g., 'created', 'updated', 'deleted')

## Common Events
- `client/created` - New client created
- `business/created` - New business created
- `meeting/created` - New meeting scheduled
- `meeting/cancelled` - Meeting cancelled
- `payment/paid` - Payment received
- `invoice/issued` - Invoice issued

## Error Responses
Returns HTTP 500 with `{"response": "Not Subscribed"}` when subscription fails (e.g., invalid event format, service unavailable).

event.description: The event to subscribe to in the format 'entity/event_type'. The entity is the object type to monitor (e.g., 'client', 'business', 'meeting') and event_type is the action that triggers the webhook (e.g., 'created', 'updated', 'deleted', 'cancelled').

target_url.description: The URL where webhook notifications will be sent. Must be a valid URL that can receive POST requests.

201.description: Webhook subscription created successfully. Returns a subscription_id that can be used to identify this subscription.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided. The event format may be invalid (must be 'entity/event_type'), the target_url format is incorrect, or required fields are missing.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

500.description: Subscription Failed - The webhook subscription could not be created. This typically occurs when the event format is invalid, the target URL is unreachable, or the webhook service encounters an error. Note: This status code is also returned for business-rule failures that should ideally be 400 errors.

post.description:
## Overview
Unsubscribe from webhook. Note: This endpoint uses legacy parameter names ('event' and 'target_url'). The 'target_url' must match exactly the URL used when subscribing. The 'event' parameter is optional and can be used to unsubscribe from a specific event type.

Available for **Staff and Directory Tokens**.

event.description: Object / Event name to unsubscribe from (optional). If not provided, all subscriptions for the target_url will be removed.

target_url.description: The webhook URL that was used when subscribing. Must match exactly the URL used during subscription.

get.description:
## Overview
Get webhooks list.

Available for **Staff and Directory tokens**.

parameters.description:
Filtering the list of webhooks.
Filter is a 'deepObject' works with:
  1. 'entity' - object which listen to event (example: client)
  2. 'event_type' - type of event to trigger webhook (example: created)

Example:
  <url>?filter[entity]=client&filter[event_type]=created
parameters.name: filter

success.description: Indicates the success status of the request (e.g., "ok").

id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook subscription.

entity.description: Object / Event name that the webhook is subscribed to. This is the entity type being monitored. Available entities include: 'business' (business accounts), 'client' (client records), 'appointment' (scheduled appointments), 'payment' (payment transactions), 'invoice' (invoices), 'account' (account-related events), and 34 other entity types. See the enum list below for all available entities.

event_type.description: The type of event that triggers the webhook notification. This specifies what action or state change triggers the webhook. Common event types include: 'create' (object created), 'update' (object updated), 'delete' (object deleted), 'scheduled' (appointment/event scheduled), 'cancelled' (appointment/event cancelled), 'rejected' (request rejected), 'paid' (payment received), 'recorded' (payment recorded), 'issued' (invoice/estimate issued), 'sent' (message sent), and 25 other event types. See the enum list below for all available event types.

url.description: The target URL where webhook notifications will be sent.

get.description:
## Overview
Retrieves a list of features enabled for a specific business. Features represent capabilities and modules available to the business.

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

put.description:
## Overview
Updates purchased items for a business.

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

data.description: Array of purchased items to update

type.description: Type of purchased items being updated. Only 'staffs' and 'sms' are valid types.

bundled.description: Bundled items count. Represents items that are included as part of a bundle package.

purchased.description: Purchased items count. Represents items that have been individually purchased.

get.description:
## Overview
Retrieves Recurly subscription data for a business, including account codes and subscription parameters used for billing integration.

Available for **internal recurlybilling app token only**. This is an internal endpoint used by the billing system to retrieve Recurly subscription parameters.

## Overview
Get Staff List and Details (ordered by position field).

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

parameters.description: Optional fetch status. Valid values: 'active' (only active staff) or 'all' (all staff including inactive)
parameters.name: status

post.description:
## Overview
Creates a Staff Member.

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

**Content-Type**: Requires `application/json` content type header.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the business to create the staff member for.
parameters.name: business_uid
body
parameters.description: Request body containing the staff member details. **Important**: The request body must be JSON with Content-Type: application/json header. The body must contain a top-level 'staff' object wrapper with required fields: email and display_name. If the 'staff' wrapper is missing or the body is not valid JSON, the API returns 400 with error 'staff parameters are missing'.

meta.description: Optional metadata for the staff creation request.

invite.description: Send invite to staff on creation. Defaults to false if not provided.

staff.description: **Required wrapper object** containing the staff member details. This top-level 'staff' key is mandatory - omitting it results in a 400 error.

display_name.description: Display name of the staff member. Must not be longer than 255 characters and must not contain HTML tags or newlines.

email.description: Email address of the staff member. Must be unique across the platform - attempting to create a staff member with an email that already exists will return an error.

first_name.description: First name of the staff member. Must not be longer than 255 characters and must not contain HTML tags or newlines.

last_name.description: Last name of the staff member. Must not be longer than 255 characters and must not contain HTML tags or newlines.

role.description: Role code assigned to the staff member within the business. Valid values are: admin, manager, marketing, collaborator, user. Defaults to 'user' if not provided. Note: These correspond to the `code` field from GET /v3/access_control/business_roles endpoint.

400.description:
Bad Request - Validation error. Common validation errors include:
- `staff parameters are missing` - The request body must contain a 'staff' object wrapper
- `staff.email is required` - Email is a mandatory field
- `staff.email must be valid` - Email format is invalid
- `staff.email already in use` - Email address is already associated with another user in the platform
- `staff.display_name is a mandatory field` - Display name is required
- `staff.role must be valid` - Role must be one of: admin, manager, marketing, collaborator, user
- `staff.first_name must not be longer than 256` - First name exceeds maximum length
- `staff.first_name must not contain html tags` - HTML tags are not allowed
- `staff.first_name must not contain newlines` - Newline characters are not allowed
- `meta.invite should be true/false` - Invite must be a boolean value

delete.description:
## Overview
Delete Staff Member Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

get.description:
## Overview
Get Staff Details.

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

delete.description:
## Overview
End Staff Member active sessions and log out from browser Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

get.description:
## Overview
Gets a list of available wizards.

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

## Overview
Gets a wizard by given name.

Available for **Directory Tokens only**.

put.description:
## Overview
Update a wizard with given name Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

parameters.description: Business UID - the unique identifier for the business (e.g., "pihawe0kf7fu7xo1"). Note: This must be the alphanumeric UID, not the numeric ID.
parameters.name: business_id

parameters.description: Filter only active services or all. Valid values: 'true' (only active services) or 'false' (all services)

get.description:
## Overview
Get Staff List [Alpha].

Available for **Staff Tokens**.

parameters.description: Business UID - the unique identifier for the business (e.g., "pihawe0kf7fu7xo1"). Note: This must be the alphanumeric UID, not the numeric ID.
parameters.name: business_id

parameters.description: Filter only active services or all. Valid values: 'true' (only active services) or 'false' (all services)
parameters.name: only_active_services

get.description:
## Overview
Get Staff By ID [Alpha].

Available for **Staff Tokens**.

Bearer.description: Provide a valid bearer token in the Authorization header. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer {app_token}'
